name: Absol
Attack1Text: If the number of cards in your opponent's hand is at least 6, choose a number of cards there, without looking, until your opponent has 5 cards left. Have your opponent discard the cards you chose.
Attack2Text: If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Altaria
Attack1Text: During your next turn, if any of your current Active Pokémon does damage to any Defending Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack2Text: Each Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Crawdaunt
Ability1Text: As long as Crawdaunt is your Active Pokémon, when any of your Active Pokémon does damage to the Defending Pokémon, the attack does 10 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Flygon
Attack1Text: Attach any number of basic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.
Attack2Text: Does 30 damage plus 10 more damage for each type of basic Energy card attached to Flygon.

name: Golem
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on all of your Active Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Does 20 damage to 2 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon (1 if there is only 1). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Grumpig
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: If Grumpig and the Defending Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

name: Minun
Ability1Text: As long as Minun is your Active Pokémon, whenever your other Active Pokémon, if any, attacks, you may use Cheer On after the first attack (you still need the necessary Energy to use Cheer On). You can't use Cheer On more than once in this way even if your other Active Pokémon has the Chain of Events Poké-Body.
Attack1Text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (including Minun).
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. If you choose Pokémon that has a Poké-Power or Poké-Body, this attack does 40 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Plusle
Ability1Text: As long as Plusle is your Active Pokémon, whenever your other Active Pokémon, if any, attacks, you may use Cheer On after the first attack (you still need the necessary Energy to use Cheer On). You can't use Cheer On more than once in this way even if your other Active Pokémon has the Chain of Events Poké-Body.
Attack1Text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Pokémon (including Plusle).
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. If you choose Pokémon-ex, this attack does 40 damage instead. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Roselia
Ability1Text: Roselia can't be affected by any Special Conditions.
Attack1Text: Attach up to 2 Grass Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Salamence
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if Salamence is your Active Pokémon, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. This power can't be used if Salamence is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Salamence during your opponent's next turn.

name: Shedinja
Ability1Text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to Shedinja by your opponent's Evolved Pokémon and Pokémon-ex.
Attack1Text: Put 1 damage counter, plus 1 more damage counter for each damage counter on Shedinja, on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Torkoal
Attack1Text: Search your discard pile for up to 2 basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned. Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Torkoal.

name: Crawdaunt
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 30 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Dragonair
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: Remove 1 damage counter from each of your Active Pokémon.

name: Flygon
Ability1Text: Whenever Flygon would be damaged by your opponent's attack (after applying Weakness and Resistance), flip a coin. If heads, reduce that damage by 20.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard an Energy card attached to Flygon.

name: Girafarig
Attack1Text: If Girafarig and the Defending Pokémon have the same amount of Energy attached to them, pick any 1 card from your deck and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage for each Colorless Energy in that Pokémon's Retreat Cost to that Pokémon (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Magneton
Ability1Text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if you have basic Energy cards in your discard pile, you may discard any 1 card from your hand. Then search for up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. You can't return the card you first discarded to your hand in this way. This power can't be used if Magneton is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon (including Magneton).

name: Ninjask
Ability1Text: Once during your turn, when you play Ninjask from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon, you may search your deck for Shedinja and put it onto your Bench. Treat the new Benched Pokémon as a Basic Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack1Text: You may switch Ninjask with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, you may move any number of Grass Energy cards attached to Ninjask to the new Active Pokémon.

name: Salamence
Ability1Text: As long as Salamence is your Active Pokémon, any damage done to your Pokémon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
Attack1Text: You may discard an Energy card attached to Salamence. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Shelgon
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to Shelgon during your opponent's next turn. (Any other effects of attacks still happen.)

name: Skarmory
Attack1Text: If the number of cards in your opponent's hand is at least 6, look at his or her hand. Choose a number of cards there until your opponent has 5 cards left in his or her hand and have your opponent shuffle the cards you chose into his or her deck.
Attack2Text: Count the amount of Energy attached to all of your Pokémon and all of your opponent's Pokémon. If your Pokémon have less Energy than your opponent's, this attack does 20 damage plus 30 more damage.

name: Vibrava
Attack1Text: Search your deck for up to 3 different types of basic Energy cards, show them to your opponent, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Bagon
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Camerupt
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Combusken
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Dratini
Attack1Text: Remove 2 damage counters from 1 of your Pokémon (remove 1 if there is only 1).

name: Flaaffy
Attack1Text: Attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile to Flaaffy.

name: Forretress
Attack1Text: Put 2 damage counters on each Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: After your attack, you may discard 1 Energy card attached to Forretress. If you do, switch Forretress with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Graveler
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage times the amount of Energy attached to Graveler.
Attack2Text: Does 80 damage to each Active Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).

name: Graveler
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Grovyle
Attack1Text: Flip 4 coins. If all of them are heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 60 more damage. If not, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each heads.

name: Gyarados
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage to each Defending Pokémon. Discard an Energy card from each Defending Pokémon.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

name: Horsea
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage times the number of damage counters on Horsea.
Attack2Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

name: Houndoom
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, Poké-Powers, Poké-Bodies, or any other effects on that Pokémon.
Attack2Text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Houndoom.

name: Magneton
Attack2Text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage for each heads.

name: Marshtomp
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Meditite
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

name: Ninjask
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.
Attack2Text: This attack's damage is not affected by Resistance.

name: Seadra
Attack1Text: Does 20 damage plus 10 more damage for each Energy attached to Seadra but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Seadra
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all effects of an attack, including damage, done to Seadra during your opponent's next turn.

name: Shelgon
Ability1Text: As long as Shelgon has any basic Energy cards attached to it, damage done to Shelgon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Shelgon
Attack1Text: Damage done to Shelgon by an opponent's attack is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance) during your opponent's next turn.

name: Shuppet
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Put 1 damage counter on 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.

name: Snorunt
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Swellow
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat until the end of your opponent's next turn.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 50 damage to that Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.

name: Vibrava
Ability1Text: If Vibrava has any basic Energy cards attached to it, Vibrava's Retreat Cost is 0.

name: Vibrava
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

name: Whiscash
Ability1Text: As long as Whiscash is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to Whiscash by your opponent's attacks.
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Bagon
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

name: Corphish
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Corphish
Attack2Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Geodude
Attack2Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Geodude
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Grimer
Attack2Text: Discard a Grass Energy card attached to Grimer. The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Horsea
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Houndour
Attack1Text: Your opponent switches the Defending Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

name: Magikarp
Attack1Text: Search your deck for Magikarp and put as many of them as you like onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

name: Magnemite
Attack1Text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack does 10 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

name: Magnemite
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Mareep
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Mudkip
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Mudkip but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 20 damage in this way.

name: Nincada
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

name: Nincada
Attack2Text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

name: Nincada
Attack1Text: After your attack, remove from Nincada the number of damage counters equal to the damage you did to the Defending Pokémon. If Nincada has fewer damage counters than that, remove all of them.

name: Numel
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 10 more damage.

name: Numel
Attack2Text: Discard a Fire Energy card attached to Numel and then discard an Energy card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

name: Pineco
Ability1Text: Any damage done to Pineco by attacks is reduced by 10 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

name: Slugma
Attack2Text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with 1 of the Defending Pokémon. Your opponent chooses the Defending Pokémon to switch. The new Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

name: Spoink
Attack1Text: After your attack, you may switch Spoink with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

name: Spoink
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Torchic
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Trapinch
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Treecko
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 damage plus 20 more damage.

name: Wurmple
Attack1Text: Search your deck for Grass Basic Pokémon and put as many of them as you like onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Ampharos ex
Ability1Text: As long as Ampharos ex is in play, whenever your opponent attaches an Energy card to his or her Pokémon from hand, put 1 damage counter on that Pokémon. You can't put more than 1 damage counter even if there is more than 1 Ampharos ex in play.
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 40 damage plus 30 more damage. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

name: Dragonite ex
Ability1Text: As often as you like during your turn, you may move an Energy card attached to 1 of your Pokémon to Dragonite ex. This power can't be used if Dragonite ex is affected by a Special Condition.
Attack1Text: Discard a Water Energy card and a Lightning Energy card attached to Dragonite ex.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

name: Golem ex
Attack1Text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Attack2Text: Golem ex does 50 damage to itself.

name: Kingdra ex
Attack1Text: Use any attack from Kingdra ex's Basic Pokémon card or Stage 1 Evolution card. (Kingdra ex doesn't have to pay for that attack's Energy cost.)
Attack2Text: Does 50 damage plus 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to Kingdra ex but not used to pay for this attack's Energy cost. You can't add more than 40 damage in this way.

name: Latias ex
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.
Attack2Text: Discard a Fire Energy and a Water Energy attached to Latias ex.

name: Latios ex
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Latios ex.
Attack2Text: Discard 3 Energy attached to Latios ex.

name: Magcargo ex
Attack1Text: Discard the top card from your deck. If that card is a basic Energy card, attach it to Magcargo ex.
Attack2Text: You may discard any number of basic Energy cards attached to Magcargo ex when you use this attack. If you do, this attack does 40 damage plus 20 more damage for each basic Energy card you discarded.

name: Muk ex
Ability1Text: As long as Muk ex is your Active Pokémon, ignore all Poké-Powers and Poké-Bodies other than Toxic Gas.
Attack1Text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.
Attack2Text: Does 40 damage plus 10 more damage for each Colorless Energy in the Defending Pokémon's Retreat Cost (after applying effects to the Retreat Cost).

name: Rayquaza ex
Attack1Text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, search your discard pile for a basic Energy card and attach it to Rayquaza ex.
Attack2Text: Discard either all Fire Energy or all Lightning Energy attached to Rayquaza ex. This attack does 40 damage times the amount of Fire or Lightning Energy discarded.

name: Charmander
Attack2Text: Does 10 damage plus 10 more damage for each damage counter on Charmander.

name: Charmeleon
Attack1Text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
Attack2Text: Flip a coin. If tails, discard a Fire Energy card attached to Charmeleon.

name: Charizard
Attack1Text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your discard pile for 2 Fire Energy cards and attach them to Charizard (1 if there is only 1).
Attack2Text: You may discard a Fire Energy card attached to Charizard. If you do, choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon and do 30 damage to that Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
